newsitem.title: USA: MGE spring wheat ends weak in quiet dealings.
newsitem.headline: MGE spring wheat ends weak in quiet dealings.

text.p: MGE spring wheat futures ended lower after trading mixed most of the day in light volume, traders said.
Scale-down mill buying was noted but light hedge selling limited gains, traders said.
"We had a little bit of hedge selling today but much less than Friday," one trader said. "I don't think there was a heck of a lot of grain that moved over the weekend."
Wheat tried to rally at midday as CBOT wheat jumped but "we don't have anyone who wants to pay up on the rallies," one trader said.
Traders noted September spring wheat futures were trading at a six-cent premium to Chicago wheat on the close. The spread had been 11-1/4 cents on the opening.
Barley set contract lows for the December and March contracts, but volume was estimated at two lots, traders said.

"We're seeing some good selling of barley," one trader said, referring to farmer selling in the cash market. "We got (futures) down fairly close to cash prices before we finally saw some buy paper come into the pit."
Barley ended down 11 to 13 cents per cwt with September untraded at $7.40 per cwt.
Wheat ended 1/2 to five cents per bushel lower with September down 1-1/4 at $4.58-1/2.
